alert.note: Alert for Henderson; Transylvania (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 12:00AM EDT until March 25 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg SC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in North Carolina... French Broad River At Blantyre affecting Transylvania and Henderson Counties. .Periods of moderate to heavy rain over the past 24 hours has resulted in storm-total accumulations of 3-5 inches, with isolated totals approaching 6 inches, across the upper French Broad River watershed. This heavy rainfall has caused significant rises along the upper French Broad River, from Rosman, to Brevard, Blantyre, Horse Shoe, Fletcher, and Avery Creek. The upper French Broad river is expected to exceed Minor Flood Stage near Blantyre and Action/Advisory Stage at Fletcher, causing nuisance to Minor flooding of adjacent low-lying, flood-prone areas including farmland, woodlands, parks, greenways, boat-access areas, and a few secondary roads and driveways. The French Broad River is expected to remain out of its banks into Thursday night, with conditions improving by Friday morning. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...French Broad River At Blantyre. * WHEN...From late tonight to early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Minor Flood Stage. Farmland flooding continues on both sides of the French Broad River. Floodwaters begin to impact boat access areas at Grove Bridge Rd. and Crab Creek Rd. * At 17.0 feet, Minor Flooding continues. Floodwaters continue to inundate farmland between the French Broad River and the railroad tracks. Floodwaters may start to inundate the shoulders of River Road near the Big Willow Road intersection. Floodwaters continue to impact boat access areas at Grove Bridge Rd. and Crab Creek Rd. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:46 PM EDT Wednesday the stage was 15.4 feet and rising steadily. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above Minor Flood Stage late tonight to a crest of around 16.5 feet tomorrow morning. A reasonable worse-case crest near 17.0 feet is possible tomorrow. It will then fall below Minor Flood Stage tomorrow afternoon and Action/Advisory Stage by overnight Thursday. - Minor Flood Stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp
